matter.summary: Carlos Martinez, age 8, was severely bitten on the face and arm by Defendant's pit bull while playing in a public park on July 4, 2024. The dog was off-leash despite posted leash laws. Carlos required emergency surgery and continues to suffer from PTSD and facial scarring.
parties: Carlos Martinez (Minor, by and through Guardian Ad Litem Rosa Martinez)

documents.title: Animal Control Report
documents.summary: Officer Rodriguez documented the attack at Riverside Park. The pit bull, named 'Rex,' was off-leash in violation of city ordinances. Witnesses confirmed the dog charged unprovoked at Carlos who was playing on the swings.
facts: Dog had prior complaint history with Animal Control (two previous incidents)
Owner admitted dog was not properly secured
Park has clearly posted leash-law signs

documents.title: Emergency Room Records
documents.summary: St. Joseph's Hospital ER records show Carlos sustained deep lacerations to left cheek requiring 47 stitches, puncture wounds to left forearm, and severe emotional trauma.
facts: Plastic surgeon consulted for facial reconstruction
Child exhibited signs of severe distress and fear of dogs
Rabies prophylaxis administered as dog's vaccination status was uncertain

documents.title: Plastic Surgery Follow-up
documents.summary: Dr. Chen's notes indicate permanent facial scarring despite best efforts. Recommends additional scar revision surgery when child is 16 years old.
facts: Child will require multiple revision surgeries over lifetime

documents.title: Child Psychologist Evaluation
documents.summary: Dr. Linda Park diagnosed Carlos with PTSD related to the attack. Child experiences nightmares, refuses to go outdoors, and has developed severe cynophobia (fear of dogs).
facts: Ongoing therapy required for 2-3 years minimum
Child's quality of life significantly impaired
School attendance affected due to anxiety

events.description: Dog attack at Riverside Park, 3:15 PM
Emergency surgery at St. Joseph's Hospital
Animal Control seized dog; owner cited for leash law violation

issues.issue: Dog Bite Strict Liability under Cal. Civ. Code ยง 3342
facts: Defendant owned the dog that bit Carlos
Attack occurred in public park where Carlos had legal right to be

issues.issue: Negligence - Failure to Control Dangerous Animal
facts: Dog had history of aggressive behavior
Owner knew or should have known of dog's dangerous propensities

authorities.summary: Strict liability for dog bites when victim is in public place or lawfully on private property
Jury instruction for strict liability dog bite cases
Dog owner liable even for first bite under ยง 3342

strengths: Strict liability statute - no need to prove prior viciousness
Clear liability - dog off-leash in violation of law
Prior complaint history shows owner's knowledge
Sympathetic minor victim with permanent scarring
weaknesses: Defendant may have limited insurance coverage
Some witnesses left before giving statements
concessions: Willing to structure settlement with trust for future medical expenses
Open to confidentiality agreement if it increases settlement value
evidentiary_gaps: Need to obtain dog's complete veterinary and complaint history
Pending life care plan from medical economist
